Package academy.mindswap.Connect4

Class Game

java.lang.Object
academy.mindswap.Connect4.Game
All Implemented Interfaces:
Runnable
public class Game extends Object implements Runnable
This class is responsible for running the game and implements the functional Interface Runnable.

  • Constructor Details

    • Game

      public Game(PlayerHandler[] array, Server server)
      Construct method that initialize the players and create the board.
      Parameters:
      array - an array of PlayerHandler objects.
      server - a Server object.

  • Method Details

    • gameProcess

      private void gameProcess()
      This is the method that contains all the logic of the game. The players are set with corresponded Chars. Then sends messages for the players to inform their turn. Receives the players moves and check if one of them won. When a game ends, the players are asked if they would like to continue playing.

    • checkIfWantsToPlay

      private void checkIfWantsToPlay(PlayerHandler player)
      A method that verifies if the players want to continue playing.

    • playAgain

      private void playAgain(PlayerHandler player)
      This method is responsible for managing the players choice to continue playing or not.
      Parameters:
      player - a PlayerHandler object.

    • broadCast

      private void broadCast(String message)
      Responsible for sending a message to both players.
      Parameters:
      message - the String that is sent to the players.

    • playValidation

      private boolean playValidation(int move, PlayerHandler player)
      Checks if the column selected by the player is not full.
      Parameters:
      move - the number that represents which column the player wants to insert his move
      player - a PlayerHandler object.
      Returns:
      boolean

    • play

      private void play(int move, char playerChar)
      Inserts the move in board.
      Parameters:
      move - the number that represents which column the player wants to insert his move
      playerChar - the respective piece from the player

    • checkWinner

      private boolean checkWinner(char playerChar, PlayerHandler playerHandler)
      Verifies if someone won or if it was a draw.
      Parameters:
      playerChar - a char that represents the respective piece from the player
      playerHandler - a PlayerHandler object.
      Returns:
      boolean
